intro: Chaerophyllum heldreichii, commonly known as the Balkan cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and forest edges. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
